page.title: 03TOURIST ATTRACTIONS-NO2
page.content:
At the end of the road leading to Sinsharnie Farm there towers a rock face which is a great source of interest at all seasons of the year.
During the winter giant icicles hang from the rock face and passing motorists often stop to gaze fascinated at the sight. Spring has arrived when the last icicle falls from the rock face.
In the spring all the crevices in the rock are filled with pale yellow primroses.
Geologists come from far and near to chip away at the rock in the hope of finding garnets which are embedded there.
